text: Some shun the shameful black powder, not you though, you revel in it and all engines of destruction.
The bow is a weapon that never jams, a weapon you can always trust.
Warriors of great armies are decorated in ornate armour taken from the Sultan's personal armory, even the slaves!
The longer one spends with the "savages" the easier it is to rile them up in battle.
The common folk might revere the Djinns, but the powerful and wise see through the superstitions, they are tools and nothing more!
They call him the beast tamer, for these creatures would fight for him.
They call him the beast whisperer, for these creatures would truly die for him.
You are wise in the ways of magic and have much to teach others.
You have seen many brothers fall in battle, for that is what the nomads are, my brothers.
Veterans among the settled peoples, or "hadir", of Araby are able to be bestowed with titles and finery befitting their contribution to these great lands.
Despite the slander that envious men like to spread, most Grand Viziers in Araby are loyal servants to their lieges and dedicated administrators of their assigned provinces.

Many Grand Viziers reach their lofty positions thanks to both their knowledge in the magical arts and their advances in the sciences, for in Araby there's little difference between the study of the natural world and the supernatural world.
The rumours about the dubious moral integrity of Arabyan Grand Viziers are not entirely unfounded, for there are many among them who abuse their privileges to indulge in the study of the Dark Arts.
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
The mount of any self-respecting Arabyan gentleman.
The mount of any self-respecting Arabyan gentleman.
The mount of any self-respecting Arabyan gentleman.
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
The mount of any self-respecting Arabyan gentleman.
Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.
The sorcerer utters a blessing onto the weapons of his allies, imbuing their attacks with the magic of the elements.
Bright beams of burning energy leap from the wizard's eyes and scythe through all before him.
Commanding the desert spirit of Da'ru'de, the sorcerer engulfs his foes in a swirling cloud of choking sand and dust.
The wizard turns the ground into bottomless quicksand, dragging any unfortunates down into the abyss.
As if possessed by a Fire Efreet, the caster conjures scorching flames from his hands to burn his enemies to a crisp.
Channeling the immense powers of the Djinn through his own body, the sorcerer lays a terrible curse upon his foes.
Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.
Commanding the desert spirit of Da'ru'de, the sorcerer engulfs his foes in a swirling cloud of choking sand and dust.
The relentless drive and fury of the unnamed god, harnessed for the protection of this wardâ€™s bearer.
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Servants carrying a large Djinn Vessel.
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Servants carrying a large Djinn Vessel.
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Servants carrying a large Djinn Vessel.
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Servants carrying a large Djinn Vessel.
The Prince of Pleasure has gotten to this one...

Inside this ornate staff decorated with snake motifs is bound a malignant and ancient Serpent Djinn, imprisoned by powerful enchantments woven by Jaffar. Only Jaffar's will is strong enough to temporarily unleash it upon his enemies on the battlefield.

Ibn Naggazar was a brilliant, if somewhat maniacal Arabyan sorcerer. Whilst it is unknown whether his madness sprang from isolation, too many attempts at creating intoxicating elixirs or the honeyed promises of whispering daemons. There can be no doubt he was utterly mad.
Let us turn the oasis into wine so that the crusaders may succumb to their beloved tipple.
Moving across the sands of Araby tirelessly.
Living in such a hostile land gives warriors and beasts alike a great advantage.
The Sultans Great power comes from making allies with those who posses it, but it comes at a price.
Risen from the grave, Jaffar has made an unthinkable pact and seeks revenge on those who fell him.
Jaffar is a vainglorious man, it is no wonder then that the prestigious camel is one of his favourite mounts to ride into battle.
From on top the howdah of a mighty Arabyan Royal Elephant, Sultan Jaffar gazes down upon the battlefield with only imperious cruelty and disdain in his eyes.
Jaffar's hunger for power knows to bounds. There's no pact he won't make or enemy he won't crush on his path to conquest.

During his initial unification of Araby, Jaffar condemned all those who opposed him to the life of a slave. So it shall be again; Arabyans, Estalians, Bretonnians, Greenskins, no matter who or what they are, all of Jaffar's enemies shall kneel before and serve the Great Sultan.
The Serpent Guard are Sultan Jaffar's personal elite bodyguard. They are devoted to their Sultan and aligned with Jaffar's goals of Arabyan dominance.

Jaffar possesses a compelling charisma, which in the past allowed him to sway many Arabyan tribes and city-states to his side. His death and return to life certainly have not dulled his oratory skills.
Nothing will stop me, not the Northerners, the Elves, the Dwarfs, Settra's lackeys or anyone else! I will rule this world, or see it burnt to ashes around me!
No land shall remain beyond my grasp. No kingdom shall be beyond my mandate. Go forth. Conquer. Rule.

Fatandira had always known she was of Arabyan Nomad stock, but only recently, with her journey to the Southlands, she has discovered her Scythan legacy. Her arrival proved fortuitous, for one of the Scythan tribal leaders had fallen to Chaos and was attempting to take control of the entire realm. It was then that the more righteous members of the tribe rallied around Fatandira, asking her to lead them against the servants of darkness.
Back in the Borderlands, Fatandira had quite the reputation as a crossbow markswoman among her troops. Since returning to her people, she has applied her skills to the Scythan way of the hunter.
Be as cunning as the sand fox, strike as swift as the falcon.
Since her tenure as Prince in the Borderlands, Fatandira has sought to end the bigotry and hate that plague any land she rules. Her principality might be long gone, but the ideal stands strong.

Even back in the Border Princes, Fatandira was well known for her cavalry tactics and the swiftness of her mounted troops. Imagine what she can do with a saddle-born people such as the Scythans under her command.

Since her arrival at Scythan lands, Fatandira has been hailed as "Al-Kahina", The Prophetess, by her people. The Scythans claim that she's the hero of legend that will banish the Darkness with the Golden God by her side. Fatandira herself doesn't quite believe the legend, but keeps up the appearance for the morale of her troops and well-being of her people.
...From now on my destiny will be to lift these people out of ignorance and poverty, to prevent them from becoming as paranoid and vicious as the villagers who butchered my family. This I swear.
Fatandira is a woman with an iron determination. She leads honestly, and personally ensures that her troops have talent in battle and good sense out of it.
Fatandira has adapted her famously stealthy cavalry strikes from the rough terrain of the Border Princes to the sands of Araby and Nehekhara almost seamlessly.
Taken by Fatandira from the tomb of the Liche Lord Karitamen in the Borderlands, this pair of Nehekharan Khopeshes magically enhance their owner's combat skills, and weakens anyone struck by them.
Born to a family of Arabyan caravan nomads, Fatandira is as comfortable on the saddle as on foot.

Given to Fatandira as a gift by the Scythans, Saqir is a mighty specimen of Desert Roc, giant and intelligent birds of prey that fly high above the deserts of Araby. The animal quickly bonded with her, and now they soar the battlefield together.

This ancient magical lamellar cuirass is said to have belonged to a legendary warrior queen of the Scythans who killed one of the great Priest Kings of Ancient Nehekhara in battle. The Scythans, believing Fatandira to be a reincarnation of that queen, have granted to her this ancient artifact.
Those proved in battle may take a sacred vow to their god Tutankhanut and serve as his mortal champion.

The Golden Magus' mastery over the elements of air, fire and water is exceptional, especially for a human. His powers come from his most prized possessions, 3 Royal Djinns from who he draws his magical might from.

The secret of the Golden Magus' sorcerous might resides in his connection, or "aethyric tether" with 3 magic urns in his possession. Imprisoned inside are 3 powerful elemental spirits, siphoned of their power for the Magus' benefit.
For someone who cultivates the image of an elderly eccentric scholar, the Golden Magus is surprisingly spry, fast and adept at combat.
Some whisper that the Magus is in complete thrall of the malignant Architect of Fate. Nonsense, of course, but like with all good rumours, there's might be a grain of truth to it...

Beneath all the eccentricity and gaudiness hides a callous corsair, eager to bring more magical treasures to his collection, more slaves to his servitude, more concubines to his harem and more power to himself.

The Golden Magus can impart much knowledge onto those aspirants willing to learn the sorcerous arts - if they can stand the eccentric nature of his lessons and the Magus' ever so condescending manners.

The Golden Magus is an expert in the art of binding the elemental spirits known as "djinns" to his will. Stored in the Magus' flagship are thousands of warded urns, each containing a potent djinn ready and willing to obey his every command.

The Magus has enslaved many a djinn to his will, to such degree that they cannot reject any of his wishes and commands. Djinns though are capricious and free-spirited entities, and their service should not be taken for granted.

One of the Golden Magus' most infamous creations, this fiery curved sword is kept most of the time inside a jar filled with a slimy orange solution. When drawn out of it, the sword catches a mystical fire that the Magus' uses for battle, theatrics and summoning Djinn spirits. Contrary to popular belief, the ship is named after the sword.

The Magus' ostentatious golden robes are not just a flamboyant show of wealth, they possess potent enchantments that the Magus discovered in a parchment at the ruined city of Bel-Aliad. Besides providing protection from harm, these wards are curiously nocive to the Undead.
Though vigorous for his old age, the Golden Magus often rides to battle on one of his many camels - out of flamboyance if anything else.

Much like the Magus' infamous flagship, this enchanted skiff is proof of his mastery over the Djinn. Held "afloat" on the air by servile Lesser Tempest Djinn oarsmen, this is one of the Golden Magus' favourite ways to ride to battle.
From the sea we take, to the sea we give.

Hailing from the highest peaks of the World's Edge Mountains, Arabyans just like the northern Imperials are willing to pay vast sums of gold for a single egg or chick such the renown of these majestic beasts.
A fine-blade presented to Arabyan Warriors who have proved themselves in battle, gaining them respect from all.
It is said that Armour fashioned from the carapace of the Dune Scorpion is stronger and lighter than any metal variety.
They try to protect the innocent and drive evil from the lands and while the northern men can't see past their own prejudices but there are others in this world who fight for good.
They will do anything in their pursuit of power even bargaining with Chaos or scheming with Ratmen.
From a far-flung tribe, their power and wealth is a great asset.
A sorcerer of skill can bend Djinn to their will, the spirit fighting with every ounce of its strength against its master's enemies, making the magical jars they come from highly sought after.
Elephants are unstoppable beasts. Trained on the battlefield, they lead Araby's leaders to war, wiping out everything that gets in their way.
A great man, master of war, risen through the ranks and rewarded with the Crescent Seal giving them the authority to lead a great Arabyan War Throng.
Some say he was born on a Dhow but all agree he's a master of the sea.
Not many can claim to "own" an army.
An apprentice from the revered Palace of the Wizard Caliph.
Born in the dunes, some will never see him as their equal.
Smoke and loud bangs emanate day and night from this one's tent.
He has more in common with the beasts than his fellow man.
He demands all under his command train with the bow.
A hero feared and renowned in much of Araby.
Those proven proficient in magic are gifted the Rattlesnake Staff by the Wizard Caliph, it is the mark of any good Arabyan sorcerer.
Endless days in the dunes has left this one dogged and burly.
Fine heavy armour, though its weight stifles movement.
His mind is as immovable as his body.
Ancient sword art which dazzles the many who have not seen it.
They twist and turn like a fierce sandstorm.
The Golden Magus had fought against the Vampire Coast bitterly, and now makes use of their necromantic arts against them.
A Sheikh will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.

One major advantage the camel provides for these mounted archers is simply a better angle for their arrows to aim true than from their horse counterparts. Albeit, mounted archery on a camel is no easy task!
An officer will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.
The barded steeds of the nobles are the greatest chargers from a nation that prides itself on its equestrian pedigree.
Elephants are unstoppable beasts. Trained on the battlefield, they lead Araby's leaders to war, wiping out everything that gets in their way.
Palace Guard are among the most prestigious soldiers, tasked with the protection of the Sheiks.
Some only fight for fame and glory, becoming well-trained champions in the process.
It is important to stay grounded when climbing up the chain of command.
Even from within their vessels the Djinn will protect their masters.
They won't feel a thing... unless you want them to.
When you are the target of a Hashishi, you'll never know it until it is too late.
After years of service and loyalty, a Hashishi will receive the mark of the brotherhood.
Armed with long-barrelled arquebus of Arabyan design, the endless deserts have taught these men the value of marksmanship and an accurate firearm.
Even the smallest acts of kindness can mean to world to someone in need.
Some people simply can't get enough.
In the eyes of the brave, danger gleams like sunshine.
This one has gained deep knowledge about local cultures and politics.
A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.
People say you can't trust him, he'll betray anybody for the right price.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve his long-term aims.
This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
An entourage of laborers and eunuchs accompany this caravan.
Running this caravan is the most contact his tribe has had with the world in years.
Of the Tuareg tribe. Their typical fight-for-coin lifestyle doesn't suit him, so he's taken to trading. There's still a lot of fighting though.
Born and raised in Ras Karim, he spent his early days walking up and down the Street of the Scholars. Some of that ingenuity must have rubbed off on him.
A secretive history allows him to call upon veteran troops who perhaps served him in the past.
Reject the false Cult of Djinns, and return to worshipping the One!
In Araby, reputation is a powerful tool, and those favoured by sultans and emirs will be able to recruit quality troops.
Once of the Sultan's artillery legions. Though now an independent trader, those ties are hard to break.
Many masters of the continent spanning caravans come from the peasant oases or the slums of the Araby's mighty cities.
Now did I buy the powder from the Dwarfs or the Cathayans? Ah well, it probably doesn't matter.
Crack open a few kegs of Tialva or Arag and you've got some friends for life.
The caravan and its master spends a lot of time in the Land of Chivalry, to the point that he prefers the company of foreigners to his homeland.
A band of corsairs and their captain, turned to a life of honest work? Sure, if you ignore string of unsolved burglaries they leave in their wake.
According to the Kitab al-Filaha al-Martekiyya, nasty weather can be predicted and avoided by careful observation of wind movements, the lunar phases, and planetary astral alterations.
This caravan is a front for the Cult of the Djinns, hoping to spread their message to the wider world.
Brought up in the Southlands, with an intimate knowledge of its denizens and geography.
Fangweasels, Bonechewers, Indrikas, Lake-Lions? All out of stock, but could I interest you in this Giant Vulture?
Did you know that elephants are the world's 89th largest land animal?
